metadata.title: CVE-2022-3550 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in X.org Server. Affected by this vulnerability is the function _GetCountedString of the file xkb/xkb.c. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211051.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.1').
xwayland package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.1').
